speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: SCENE IV. Florence. The Widow's house.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Enter HELENA, Widow, and DIANA

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That you may well perceive I have not wrong'd you,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: One of the greatest in the Christian world

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Shall be my surety; 'fore whose throne 'tis needful,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Ere I can perfect mine intents, to kneel:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Time was, I did him a desired office,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Dear almost as his life; which gratitude

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Through flinty Tartar's bosom would peep forth,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And answer, thanks: I duly am inform'd

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: His grace is at Marseilles; to which place

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: We have convenient convoy. You must know

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I am supposed dead: the army breaking,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: My husband hies him home; where, heaven aiding,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And by the leave of my good lord the king,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: We'll be before our welcome.

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Gentle madam,

speaker: Widow
text_entry: You never had a servant to whose trust

speaker: Widow
text_entry: Your business was more welcome.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Nor you, mistress,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Ever a friend whose thoughts more truly labour

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: To recompense your love: doubt not but heaven

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Hath brought me up to be your daughter's dower,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: As it hath fated her to be my motive

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And helper to a husband. But, O strange men!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That can such sweet use make of what they hate,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: When saucy trusting of the cozen'd thoughts

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Defiles the pitchy night: so lust doth play

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: With what it loathes for that which is away.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But more of this hereafter. You, Diana,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Under my poor instructions yet must suffer

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Something in my behalf.

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Let death and honesty

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Go with your impositions, I am yours

speaker: DIANA
text_entry: Upon your will to suffer.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Yet, I pray you:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But with the word the time will bring on summer,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: When briers shall have leaves as well as thorns,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And be as sweet as sharp. We must away;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Our wagon is prepared, and time revives us:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: All's well that ends well; still the fine's the crown;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Whate'er the course, the end is the renown.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Exeunt
